title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 332.1 - General procedures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 332.1 - General procedures

State Regulations
(a) Petitions for discretionary issuance of a declarative ruling concerning the
applicability to any person, property or state of facts of any rule or statute
enforceable by the Office of General Services shall be in writing and
subscribed by the petitioner. The petitioner shall specify the applicable rule
or statute and shall provide a complete and precise statement of the facts and
circumstances prompting the petition, together with a full disclosure of
petitioner's interest. Any facts alleged in the petition shall be verified
under oath by the petitioner. Petitions shall be addressed to the Commissioner
of General Services by certified mail, return receipt requested. The returned
post office receipt shall constitute proof of service, which shall be deemed
effective on the day such petition is received. (b) Counsel for the Office of General

Services shall receive such petitions and recommend responsive declarative
ruling or advise that an application should be declined as incomplete, ambiguous, inappropriate or unnecessary under the facts and circumstances
recited in the petition. (c) Any
declarative ruling issued by the Office of General Services shall be available
for public inspection at the office of the records access officers of the

Office of General Services in accordance with Part 330 of Title 9 of the

Official Compilation of Codes, Rules and Regulations of the State of New

York. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
332.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
